column1:
Take a complete medical history from women with nocturia, including screening for sleep 
disorders.

Use a validated questionnaire during assessment of women with nocturia and for 
re-evaluation during and/or after treatment.
Use a three-day bladder diary to assess nocturia in women.
Do not use nocturnal-only bladder diaries to evaluate nocturia in women.

Consider screening for sleep disorders and performing renal function, thyroid function, 
HbA1c and calcium level blood tests in the initial workup of women presenting with nocturia 
as predominant symptom.
